meanings.definition: A low protective wall along the edge of a roof, bridge, or balcony.
meanings.sent1: The parapet on the balcony kept us safe from falling.
meanings.sent2: The castle had a sturdy parapet surrounding its walls.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the parapet but ended up tumbling down.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed over the parapet, reaching everyone below.
meanings.sent5: The parapet stood like a guardian, watching over the city.

meanings.sent1: The workers will parapet the new building for added safety.
meanings.sent2: They decided to parapet the bridge to prevent accidents.
meanings.sent3: He tried to parapet the fence, but his tools were not cooperating.
meanings.sent4: She carefully parapeted the wall, ensuring it was secure.
meanings.sent5: The team will parapet the structure before the storm arrives.
